primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God interrupts the static, decaying human condition by sovereignly fulfilling His promise through the Incarnation, independent of human competence.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord himself will build a house for you
He has reached down into my deepest and most uncomfortable self

object.identificatie: The establishment of an everlasting kingdom/house (Salvation/Presence)
tekstueel_bewijs: his kingdom will have no end
the message was said to be, not from man, but from God

ontvanger.identificatie: David, Mary, the 'ignorant and dying' (The Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: I'm going to build a house for you
Emmanuel shall come to thee, O Israel
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the passive, needy Receiver.

helper.identificatie: The Angel Gabriel / The Word / The Prophet Nathan
tekstueel_bewijs: The angel Gabriel has bisected the ghastly yellow clouds
The Word of the Lord came to Nathan
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Angel is the instrument of transmission.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Impotence, and the 'Precariousness of being human'
tekstueel_bewijs: the kind of humiliating decline that we all pray to escape
the arm of flesh will fail you
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral lapse but the ontological reality of death and the 'infernal aspect' of a world where 'nothing moves'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Humanity's attempt to build for God (David's temple) or secure its own future (Updike/Statecraft).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: David / Mankind
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly rejected by the Sender ('Are you the one to build me a house?') to make way for the primary program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord himself will build a house
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we dare not trust our own

voorbeelden: we are invited to live with our deeper selves
the kind of humiliating decline that we all pray to escape
at three o’clock in the morning I know that I am ignorant
the only power in heaven and earth that is able to do such a thing
God has moved, not we to him in our impotence

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (power) and the absolute 'Pouvoir' of God. It is a theology of Divine Ability vs Human Inability.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Death/Updike), moves to ~S1 (David's failed plans), and is bisected by S1 (The Annunciation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God 'bisecting' the human circle from the outside.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death and impotence are described with visceral realism.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric preaching. It systematically deconstructs human agency to make God the sole Subject of the salvific action.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: You aren’t going to build a house for me, I’m going to build a house for you.
ignorant, dying, and filling this bit of Finland with the smell of my stale sweat

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is introduced as a hero but immediately deconstructed into a pathetic, dying man to show his need for God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: David is the recipient of a promise he cannot fulfill.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-salvation; comfort in the face of mortality.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The movement from the 'pathetic' David to the 'bisecting' Angel is perfectly integrated.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The vicious circle of our existence has been bisected by the Son of the Most High.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Christological 'Annunciation' rather than the internal work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'impotence' and 'death'—a state of being rather than just bad choices.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is entirely driven by God as Subject. The human actant is correctly positioned as the helpless Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is for an Advent sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the trap of using David as a moral example and instead uses him as a foil for God's sovereign grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the Updike anecdote's pathos, Greimas shows that Updike functions as an actant of 'Human Impotence' to validate the need for a 'Divine Subject'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Davidic covenant; semiotics shows how the preacher 're-acts' that covenantal structure for the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Virgin Birth' is treated not as a biological oddity but as a semiotic necessity: the 'bisecting' of a closed human system by an external Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'three o'clock in the morning' motif to strip the hearer of all actantial power, preparing them for the 'Annunciation'.
